p: Family Flaviviridae, genus Flavivirus, includes important mosquito-borne human pathogens such as the yellow fever, Zika, West Nile and dengue viruses, all found in Africa [ 1]. Dengue viruses (DENV-1 to 4) have a significant impact on public health globally, but their impact in Africa is less characterized, and the available information and sequence data are fragmented [ 2, 3].
